### <span style="color: #ed4d7e"><a href="https://palaeoverse.org" style="text-decoration: none;">palaeoverse</a></span> &nbsp; [![DOI](https://img.shields.io/badge/DOI-10.31223%2FX5Z94Q-blue)](https://doi.org/10.31223/X5Z94Q) &nbsp;[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/palaeoverse)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=palaeoverse) &nbsp;[![CRAN downloads](https://cranlogs.r-pkg.org/badges/grand-total/palaeoverse)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=palaeoverse)

<p align="justify">The palaeoverse R package is a community-driven toolkit to support the preparation and exploration of palaeobiological data. The package provides a suite of auxiliary functions, is open-source, and freely available from the <span style="color: #ed4d7e"><a href="https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/palaeoverse/index.html" style="text-decoration: none;">CRAN</a></span>. palaeoverse has three core principles: (1) streamline data preparation and exploration; (2) enhance code readability; and (3) improve reproducibility of results. It is my hope that over time, palaeoverse will be adopted and developed by the community, with contributors and users from across the globe.</p>

![](./logo_palaeoverse.png){width=15%}

### <span style="color: #ed4d7e"><a href="http://rphylopic.palaeoverse.org" style="text-decoration: none;">rphylopic</a></span> &nbsp;[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/rphylopic)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=rphylopic) &nbsp;[![CRAN downloads](https://cranlogs.r-pkg.org/badges/grand-total/rphylopic)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=rphylopic)

<p align="justify">The rphylopic R package allows users to add silhouettes of organisms from the <span style="color: #ed4d7e"><a href="http://phylopic.org/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none;">PhyloPic website</a></span> to plots generated in base R and ggplot2. The package was originally developed and maintained by <span style="color: #ed4d7e"><a href="https://scottchamberlain.info/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none;">Scott Chamberlain</a></span>.
From ver. 1.0.0, the package is now developed and maintained by myself and <span style="color: #ed4d7e"><a href="https://williamgearty.com" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none;">William Gearty</a></a></span>
from the <span style="color: #ed4d7e"><a href="https://palaeoverse.org/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none;">Palaeoverse</a></span> team. The package is open-source, and freely available from the <span style="color: #ed4d7e"><a href="https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/rphylopic/index.html" style="text-decoration: none;">CRAN</a></span>.</p>

![](./logo_rphylopic.png){width=15%}

### <span style="color: #ed4d7e"><a href="http://sepkoski.palaeoverse.org" style="text-decoration: none;">sepkoski</a></span> &nbsp; [![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/564230284.svg)](https://zenodo.org/badge/latestdoi/564230284) &nbsp;[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/sepkoski)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=sepkoski) &nbsp;[![CRAN downloads](https://cranlogs.r-pkg.org/badges/grand-total/sepkoski)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=sepkoski)

<p align="justify">The sepkoski R package is a light and easy solution to access Sepkoski's fossil marine animal genera compendium. The package provides access to the raw dataset, a dataset with intervals standardised to the International Geological Time Scale, and plotting functionality for reproducing Sepkoski's Phanerozoic curve. The package is open-source, and freely available from the <span style="color: #ed4d7e"><a href="https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/sepkoski/index.html" style="text-decoration: none;">CRAN</a></span>.</p>

![](./logo_sepkoski.png){width=15%}
